flawed_nl_solution:
We know that Josh must be 30 years older than his age when they got married, therefore he is 30 + 22 = <<30+22=52>>52 years old today
If their current combined age is 5 times the age Josh was when they married (22), then their total combined age is 5 * 22 = <<5*22=101>>101 years
That means that Anna must be 101 - 52 = <<101-52=49>>49 years old today
If they married 30 years ago, Anna must have been 49 - 30 = <<49-30=19>>19 years old when they married

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 110, not 101. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
